A Song <FI>or<Fi> Psalm of David. O God, my heart is fixed; I will sing and give praise, even with my glory.
Awake, psaltery and harp: I <FI>myself<Fi> will awake early.
I will praise thee, O LORD, among the people: and I will sing praises unto thee among the nations.
For thy mercy <FI>is<Fi> great above the heavens: and thy truth <FI>reacheth<Fi> unto the clouds.<RF>clouds: or, skies<Rf>
Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens: and thy glory above all the earth;<CM>
That thy beloved may be delivered: save <FI>with<Fi> thy right hand, and answer me.
God hath spoken in his holiness; I will rejoice, I will divide Shechem, and mete out the valley of Succoth.
Gilead <FI>is<Fi> mine; Manasseh <FI>is<Fi> mine; Ephraim also <FI>is<Fi> the strength of mine head; Judah <FI>is<Fi> my lawgiver;
Moab <FI>is<Fi> my washpot; over Edom will I cast out my shoe; over Philistia will I triumph.
Who will bring me into the strong city? who will lead me into Edom?
<FI>Wilt<Fi> not <FI>thou<Fi>, O God, <FI>who<Fi> hast cast us off? and wilt not thou, O God, go forth with our hosts?
Give us help from trouble: for vain <FI>is<Fi> the help of man.
Through God we shall do valiantly: for he <FI>it is that<Fi> shall tread down our enemies.<CM>
